sen.j: 里（り）は、尺貫法における長さの単位である。
sen.e: Ri is a unit of length in shakkanho (old Japanese system of weights and measures).

sen.j: 現在の日本では約4km、中国では500m、朝鮮では約400mに相当する。
sen.e: It is equivalent to about 4 km in today's Japan, 500 m in China and about 400 m in Korea.
sen.cmt: 用語統一ﾘｽﾄの指示により、fourは一桁数字ですが周囲との統一のためｱﾗﾋﾞｱ数字で記載しました。

sen.j: 里は元々は古代中国の周代における長さの単位であった。
sen.e: Originally it was a unit of length during the Zhou period in ancient China.

sen.j: 1里は1800尺（360歩 (尺貫法)、6町 (単位)）四方の面積を表していた。
sen.e: One ri represented the area of 1800 shaku (unit of length, approx. 30.3 cm) square (1800 shaku is equivalent to 360 bu [unit of length in shakkanho] or 6 cho [unit of length, approx. 109 m]).

sen.e: Later, the length of its one side became the unit of length 'ri'.

sen.e: 'Ri' came down to Japan in those days and one ri was set as 5 cho in the Ritsuryo System.

sen.e: There appeared various length of ri (36 chori, 40 chori, 48 chori and so on) because people's pace of walking was different according to topography and road conditions.
